title: What if Randuin's active removed Crit Chance for a few seconds?
body:
Instead of lowering the damage taken or slowing, it would be cool if it stripped enemies of Critical Strike Chance for a few seconds to give you and your allies a window to deal with fed enemies.

The only problems would be Yasuo and Tryndamere :/
Alternatively, it could reduce Critical Strike damage to like 50% instead of 100% for the duration.

Edit: OR the pulse could be much larger and create like a 0% Crit Chance field.

Tanks have high survivability but lower damage. ADCs have typically low survivability and very high damage. Plus, if they had {{item:3508}} , they would lose 20% CDR too, since they would lose crit. That's cool and all, but I think it would stupid hard to balance.

Crit in general is stupid hard to balance though, crit also negates armor pretty hard as well.

What if it was just 50% damage reduction from crits?
Enemies can still crit for bonus effects (whether it's Yasuo R's bonus armor pen, Tryndamere's CD reduction, Ashe's extra slow, etc.), but the bonus damage would be reduced so that they'll basically do no bonus damage.

That would be better, but 50% is a lot of damage reduction. Moreover, it reduces the efficiency of IE passive that way, making IE only deal 125% damage per crit, versus 250%. That accounts to a 125% decrease in damage total (250% representing the total, and 125% being the amount lost, leaving 125% of the total as the damage being dealt). There are also factors of when this reduction is taking place; this could reduce the efficiency of {{item:3075}}  since the active isn't considering armor for the damage reflection.

I'm not trying to be a hard case, these are just real questions that would need to be addressed for this idea to go anywhere.

The original idea was to remove crit chance altogether, so I thought this would have the same effect (damage wise). We can just lower the reduction to 20~30%, or change the duration to balance it better.

In a sense it would. 

The duration couldn't exceed 5 seconds imo, fights can usually be decided by that point. 

Reduction would probably need to stay in that range. 

Other issue I can think of is this item crowding out other armor items like {{item:3742}}  did on release.
It would be 175% damage with IE.

100% damage from the base attack damage, an additional 100% damage from the crit, and an additional 50% crit damage from Infinity Edge.

The total attack deals 250% damage, but only 150% is from the crit. 50% of 150 is 75. Add that to the base 100% damage for a total of 175% damage.

Unless of course y'all are talking about reducing the _total_ damage from crits, including the base damage. But that would be retarded, since normal crits would then deal the same damage as normal attacks. Just reduce the bonus damage from the crits by 50%, not the entire attack.

> Unless of course y'all are talking about reducing the _total_ damage from crits, including the base damage.

That was the premise I was working from. That was how I understood the point.
